name: NewYorker
text: “Who will hire me / Now that my spells are so easily broken, my warnings useless”: A poem by Patricia Spears Jones. https://t.co/kdM7si6mrA

name: NewYorker
text: “The more time I spent with my father-in-law’s books, the more profoundly they seemed to be not revealing him but hiding him, like some word-wreathed, untranslatable mausoleum.” https://t.co/3jG7220kyg

name: NewYorker
text: The fast-food workers featured in Richard Renaldi’s photographs are “people that millions of Americans see every day—but, at the same time, they’re invisible, because a lot of low-wage labor isn’t appreciated and is taken for granted,” he said. https://t.co/vUIkdD755g
